Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: sed

Arguments.Name: E
Arguments.Description: Interprets regular expressions as extended (modern) regular expressions rather than basic regular expressions

Arguments.Name: a
Arguments.Description: Causes sed to delay opening each file until a command containing the related ``w'' function is applied to a line of input

Arguments.Name: e
Arguments.Description: Appends the editing commands specified by the command argument to the list of commands

Arguments.Name: command
Arguments.Description: command

Arguments.Name: f
Arguments.Description: Appends the editing commands found in the file command_file to the list of commands. The editing commands should each be listed on a separate line

Arguments.Name: command_file
Arguments.Description: command_file

Arguments.Name: I
Arguments.Description: Edits files in-place, saving backups with the specified extension.  If a zero-length extension is given, no backup will be saved

Arguments.Name: extension
Arguments.Description: extension

Arguments.Name: i
Arguments.Description: Edits files in-place similarly to `-I`, but treats each file independently from other files.  In particular, line numbers in each file start at 1, the ``$'' address matches the last line of the current file, and address ranges are limited to the current file

Arguments.Name: extension
Arguments.Description: extension

Arguments.Name: l
Arguments.Description: Makes output line buffered

Arguments.Name: n
Arguments.Description: By default, each line of input is echoed to the standard output after all of the commands have been applied to it.  The `-n` option suppresses this behavior

Arguments.Name: r
Arguments.Description: Same as `-E` for compatibility with GNU sed

Arguments.Name: u
Arguments.Description: Makes output unbuffered

Arguments.Name: command
Arguments.Description: command

Arguments.Name: file
Arguments.Description: file

Arguments.Name: a
Arguments.Description: Appends `text` after a line

Arguments.Name: text
Arguments.Description: text

Arguments.Name: b
Arguments.Description: Branch unconditionally to `label`

Arguments.Name: label
Arguments.Description: label

Arguments.Name: c
Arguments.Description: Replace (change) lines with `text`

Arguments.Name: text
Arguments.Description: text

Arguments.Name: d
Arguments.Description: Delete the pattern space; immediately start next cycle

Arguments.Name: D
Arguments.Description: If pattern space contains newlines, delete text in the pattern space up to the first newline, and restart cycle with the resultant pattern space, without reading a new line of input. If pattern space contains no newline, start a normal new cycle as if the d command was issued

Arguments.Name: e
Arguments.Description: Executes the command that is found in pattern space and replaces the pattern space with the output; a trailing newline is suppressed

Arguments.Name: command
Arguments.Description: command

Arguments.Name: F
Arguments.Description: Prints the file name of the current input file

Arguments.Name: g
Arguments.Description: Replaces the contents of the pattern space with the contents of the hold space

Arguments.Name: G
Arguments.Description: Appends a newline to the contents of the pattern space, and then appends the contents of the hold space to that of the pattern space

Arguments.Name: h
Arguments.Description: Replaces the contents of the hold space with the contents of the pattern space

Arguments.Name: H
Arguments.Description: Appends a newline to the contents of the hold space, and then appends the contents of the pattern space to that of the hold space

Arguments.Name: i
Arguments.Description: Insert text before a line

Arguments.Name: text
Arguments.Description: text

Arguments.Name: l
Arguments.Description: Prints the pattern space in an unambiguous form

Arguments.Name: n
Arguments.Description: Prints the pattern space, then, regardless, replaces the pattern space with the next line of input. If there is no more input then sed exits without processing any more commands

Arguments.Name: N
Arguments.Description: Adds a newline to the pattern space, then appends the next line of input to the pattern space. If there is no more input then sed exits without processing any more commands

Arguments.Name: p
Arguments.Description: Prints the pattern space

Arguments.Name: P
Arguments.Description: Prints the pattern space up to the first newline

Arguments.Name: q
Arguments.Description: Exit sed without processing any more commands or input

Arguments.Name: Exit Code
Arguments.Description: Exit Code

Arguments.Name: Q
Arguments.Description: This command is the same as q, but will not print the contents of pattern space

Arguments.Name: Exit Code
Arguments.Description: Exit Code

Arguments.Name: r
Arguments.Description: Reads file

Arguments.Name: filename
Arguments.Description: filename

Arguments.Name: R
Arguments.Description: Queue a line of filename to be read and inserted into the output stream at the end of the current cycle, or when the next input line is read

Arguments.Name: filename
Arguments.Description: filename

Arguments.Name: s
Arguments.Description: Match the regular-expression against the content of the pattern space. If found, replace matched string with replacement

Arguments.Name: t
Arguments.Description: (test) Branch to label only if there has been a successful substitution since the last input line was read or conditional branch was taken. The label may be omitted, in which case the next cycle is started

Arguments.Name: label
Arguments.Description: label

Arguments.Name: T
Arguments.Description: (test) Branch to label only if there have been no successful substitutions since the last input line was read or conditional branch was taken. The label may be omitted, in which case the next cycle is started

Arguments.Name: label
Arguments.Description: label

Arguments.Name: v
Arguments.Description: Makes sed fail if GNU sed extensions are not supported, or if the requested version is not available

Arguments.Name: version
Arguments.Description: version

Arguments.Name: w
Arguments.Description: Writes the pattern space to the file

Arguments.Name: filename
Arguments.Description: filename

Arguments.Name: W
Arguments.Description: Writes to the given filename the portion of the pattern space up to the first newline

Arguments.Name: filename
Arguments.Description: filename

Arguments.Name: x
Arguments.Description: Exchanges the contents of the hold and pattern spaces

Arguments.Name: y
Arguments.Description: Transliterate any characters in the pattern space which match any of the source-chars with the corresponding character in dest-chars

Arguments.Name: z
Arguments.Description: (zap) Empties the content of pattern space
Comment until the next newline
